@jeet_mahal 1. Squat. 2. Deadlift. 3.1-arm dumbbell row. 4. Incline dumbbell press. 5. Straight-arm cable press-down (lats). 6. Dips. 7. Arnold press. 8. Recline DB curl. 9. (cable) Face pull. 10. "Perfect Pushup" burpees. (Weights lifted are private. One has one's vanity, after all.)

@RickSchindler You're in my class. Compared to serious lifters I'm neither big nor strong. I'm Joe Average. I work out, most often alone, in the small weight room/loft at the firehouse (I retired from firefighting last year), overlooking the trucks, engines, ambulances. It soothes my soul.

Also slightly bigger. In all my years working out w weights I've never before experienced such rapid effect. & I'm 66, when I theoretically should be fighting a losing rear-guard action against muscle loss, not getting stronger. It's like I'm on steroids or something. Freaky. 2/2

< 3 weeks ago I started a new 5 x 5 whole-body workout. Ten exercises, most of them compound (multi-joint) done in series, 5 sets of 5 reps each, short rest between sets. Intense. 1 or 2 days off between workouts. Already significantly stronger in every exercise. 1/2
